content.raw:
[new jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/114/) using a release-tools branch that combines the following pull requests:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/185/use-ignition-transport-100-in-jenkins-jobs/diff
* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/186/install-libqwt-dev-for-gazebo8-and-up/diff

content.raw: I think optional dependencies increase our build complexity, since we have more configurations to test. If it's easily available on OS X and Ubuntu, I'm fine with making it a required dependency. Also, if we're going to advertise plotting as a great new feature, we should make it a requirement
content.html: I think optional dependencies increase our build complexity, since we have more configurations to test. If it's easily available on OS X and Ubuntu, I'm fine with making it a required dependency. Also, if we're going to advertise plotting as a great new feature, we should make it a requirement
